title: Shaun ‘Jaws’ Tan
text: Shaun is a helicopter pilot by training and stumbled into the wonderful world of data analytics during the COVID lockdown. When he’s not searching the high seas for pirates, he attempts to puts his data analytics skills to good use in trying to improve his (dismal) golf game.

title: ISSS608-VAA
text:
Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Applications. In this website, you will find my sweat and blood coursework prepared for this course.



“If data is the new gold, then visual analytics is the refiner’s fire” - Anon

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed on the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.


Show the code
pacman::p_load(tidyverse)







Show the code
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed on the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.


Show the code
pacman::p_load(tidyverse)







Show the code
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")





The data in question is exam data for primary 3 students for the subjects: English, Math, and Science. In addition, the class and gender of each student is given.

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The original design


Show the code
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = RACE)) + 
  geom_bar() +
  labs(x = "Race", y = "Count", title = "Histogram of Exam Data")





Critique of this histogram:

y-aixs label is not clear (i.e. count).
The bars are not sorted by their respective frequencie (i.e. ascending or descending order)
For static graphs, additional information should be provided to each bar to allow the reader to get a better sense of the data at one glance.

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The makeover design


Show the code
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x=reorder(RACE,RACE,
                     function(x)-length(x)), fill = RACE)) + 
  geom_bar() +
  ylim(0,220) +
  geom_text(stat="count", 
      aes(label=paste0(..count.., ", ", 
      round(..count../sum(..count..)*100, 1), "%")),
      vjust=-1) +
  labs(x = "Race", y = "No. of\nPupils") +
  theme_grey() +
  theme(axis.title.y=element_text(angle = 0))

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The original design


Show the code
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) + 
  geom_histogram(bins=20) +
  ylim(0,45)





Critique of this histogram:

y-aixs label is not clear (i.e. count).
Can’t tell between each bar in the histogram
There is no clear message that this histogram is looking to tell

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The makeover design


Show the code
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="black", 
                 fill="light blue") +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept=mean(MATHS, na.rm=T)),
             color="red", 
             linetype="dashed", 
             size=1, label = "mean") +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept=median(MATHS, na.rm=T)),
             color="grey30",
             linetype="dashed", 
             size=1) + annotate("text", x=75, y=40, label="Median", angle=90, size=3, color="grey30") +
             annotate("text", x=68, y=40, label="Mean", angle=90, size=3, color="red") + ylim(0,45) + labs(x = "Math Results", y = "No. of\nPupils") +
  theme_grey() +
  theme(axis.title.y=element_text(angle = 0))

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The original design


Show the code
ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_histogram(data = exam_data, fill = "darkgrey") +
  facet_wrap(~ GENDER) +
  guides(fill = FALSE) +  
  theme_bw() + labs(x = "English Results", y = "No. of\nPupils") +
  theme_grey() +
  theme(axis.title.y=element_text(angle = 0))





Critique of these 2 histogram:

y-aixs label is not clear (i.e. count).
There difference between male and female results is not apparent as there is no reference
There is no clear message that these histograms are looking to tell

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The makeover design


Show the code
d <- exam_data   
d_bg <- d[, -3]  

ggplot(d, aes(x = ENGLISH, fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(data = d_bg, fill = "grey", alpha = .5) +
  geom_histogram(colour = "black") +
  facet_wrap(~ GENDER) +
  guides(fill = FALSE) +  
  theme_bw() +labs(x = "English Results", y = "No. of\nPupils") +
  theme(axis.title.y=element_text(angle = 0))

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The original design


Show the code
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point(size = 0.8) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))





Critique of this Scatterplot:

Points are two small
No relative reference point/line
There is no clear message that this histogram is looking to tell

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The makeover design


Show the code
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  geom_hline(yintercept=50,
             linetype="dashed",
             color="grey60",
             size=1) + 
  geom_vline(xintercept=50, 
             linetype="dashed",
             color="grey60",
             size=1) + annotate("text", x=14, y=5, label="Weak at both Subjects", angle=0, size=5, color="red") + annotate("text", x=85, y=100, label="Strong at both Subjects", angle=0, size=5, color="green") + annotate("text", x=85, y=5, label="Stronger at Maths", angle=0, size=5, color="orange") + annotate("text", x=14, y=100, label="Stronger at English", angle=0, size=5, color="orange") + 
  labs(x = "Math Results", y = "English Results")
